name: ltp
description: in-place-binary format. This is a data encoding format inspired by captnproto, but less complex. Captnproto always sounded good, but reading the docs trying to understand how it works always just made me more confused. I would start reading and be bombarded with too many clever ideas like segments and XOR defaults. It's too complex.

scripts.build: node test/generate.js > ltp.c && clang -nostdlib --target=wasm32 ltp.c -Wl,--no-entry -Wl,--export-all -o ltp.wasm
scripts.test: node test/index.js && node test/wasm.js && node test/any.js
